item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Michael Vick signs two-year deal with Philadelphia Eagles
item.description: Michael Vick has signed a two-year deal with the Eagles.

item.dc:creator: Bob Harig
item.title: Tiger Woods commands par-5s, leads PGA Championship by 1
item.description: Tiger Woods took a one-stroke lead into the clubhouse at the PGA Championship on Thursday, taking advantage of the long par 5s at Hazeltine National.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Patriots' Brady tosses two touchdowns in return
item.description: Tom Brady was making his comeback against the Philadelphia Eagles while Michael Vick was getting ready to join them.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Donte' Stallworth of Cleveland Browns suspended without pay for 2009 season
item.description: Donte' Stallworth has been suspended without pay for the 2009 season, the NFL said Thursday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Lee leads Phils to 1st Wrigley sweep in 25 years
item.description: Cliff Lee won his third straight start since joining the Philadelphia Phillies, and the NL East leaders beat the slumping Chicago Cubs 6-1 Thursday for their first sweep at Wrigley Field in 25 years.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: James Ramsey, Louisville president: Rick Pitino remains 'our guy'
item.description: University of Louisville president James Ramsey says it's time to move on after Rick Pitino's public apology for sex with a woman outside his marriage.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Verlander, Tigers blank Red Sox, avoid sweep
item.description: Justin Verlander allowed four hits in eight innings and Ryan Raburn homered for Detroit to lead the Tigers to a 2-0 victory over the Red Sox and avert a four-game sweep.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Terrell Owens expects to practice with the Buffalo Bills next week
item.description: Receiver Terrell Owens expects to return to practice next week, meaning he'll likely miss the Buffalo Bills home preseason game against Chicago this weekend because of a sprained toe.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Gomes homers in first 3 at-bats in Reds' rout
item.description: Jonny Gomes homered in his first three at-bats to back Bronson Arroyo's two-hitter and the Cincinnati Reds beat the Washington Nationals 7-0 on Thursday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Baltimore police: Michael Phelps uninjured after two-car accident
item.description: Michael Phelps was driving an SUV that collided with another car in Baltimore, but the swimmer was not injured, police said.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Bronson Arroyo of Cincinnati Reds flouting MLB, union guidance on supplements
item.description: Reds pitcher Bronson Arroyo, who last month admitted to using a now-banned supplement earlier in his career, says he uses a number of over-the-counter supplements not on Major League Baseball's approved list, according to a published report.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Fan charged for throwing beer at Philadelphia Phillies' Shane Victorino at Chicago Cubs' game
item.description: Chicago police charged a 21-year-old man with two misdemeanor counts Thursday in connection with a beer-throwing incident that showered Philadelphia Phillies center fielder Shane Victorino.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: New Mexico State Aggies requesting help from fans to provide some snacks
item.description: In a twist on Little League moms lining up after-game treats, New Mexico State's budget-conscious football staff distributed an e-mail this week asking fans to donate after-practice or late-night snacks for hungry players.

item.dc:creator: Joe Schad
item.title: Baron Batch, of Texas Tech Red Raiders, out 3-6 weeks
item.description: Texas Tech starting running back Baron Batch is expected to miss 3-to-6 weeks after sustaining an arm injury in practice, two people familiar with the injury said Thursday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Flavia Pennetta knocks Venus Williams out of Cincinnati Open
item.description: The Williams sisters have rarely had a day as miserable as this one.
